qas.question: Which three parts make up the TSFSR?

answers.text: Armenian SSR, Azerbaijan SSR, and Georgian SSR

qas.question: When did the TSFSR break up into three parts?
Who provided the Armenians with supplies?

context: The TSFSR existed from 1922 to <a2_0>1936<a2_0/>, when it was divided up into three separate entities (<a1_0>Armenian SSR, Azerbaijan SSR, and Georgian SSR<a1_0/>). Armenians enjoyed a period of relative stability under Soviet rule. They received medicine, food, and other provisions from <a3_0>Moscow<a3_0/>, and communist rule proved to be a soothing balm in contrast to the turbulent final years of the Ottoman Empire. The situation was difficult for the church, which struggled under Soviet rule. After the death of Vladimir Lenin, <a0_0>Joseph Stalin<a0_0/> took the reins of power and began an era of renewed fear and terror for Armenians.
